context_evidences: - There are risks in giving out information quickly, the chiefs said, such as tainting a grand jury, and police must be careful to note they are offering preliminary findings that may change as new details emerge. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-police-transparency/police-chiefs-pledge-more-transparency-after-ferguson-idUSKBN0HC2IC20140917 published on 2014-09-17 22:40:48

- City and county officials have been under fire since the shooting of Brown by police officer Darren Wilson spiraled into a series of nightly protests and sometimes violent rioting in Ferguson city streets. Missouri Governor Jay Nixon declared a state of emergency for the city, and sent in National Guard troops to try to quell the unrest. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-missouri-shooting/ferguson-council-to-meet-for-first-time-since-michael-brown-shooting-idUKKBN0H411320140909 published on 2014-09-09 11:08:15

- However, the Obama administration investigation, conducted by the Criminal Section of the Department of Justice Civil Rights Division, the United States Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of Missouri and the FBI, found that “the evidence does not support an indictment of [officer] Darren Wilson.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/08/harris-warren-wrong-about-brown-shooting/ published on 2019-08-12 22:33:58

- Tension remains high in the mostly black community of 21,000 a month to the day after the Aug. 9 shooting. Protesters are demanding the arrest of the officer who shot and killed 18-year-old Michael Brown, as well as the ouster of both Mayor James Knowles III and Ferguson Police Chief Tom Jackson. They also are seeking a series of changes to the city’s policing policies and the municipal court system. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-missouri-shooting/ferguson-council-to-meet-for-first-time-since-michael-brown-shooting-idUKKBN0H411320140909 published on 2014-09-09 11:08:15

- The Washington Post Fact Checker in March 2015 cited the DOJ report in debunking a popular belief that Brown had raised his hands in surrender and said “don’t shoot.” The DOJ investigation found: “Witness accounts suggesting that Brown was standing still with his hands raised in an unambiguous signal of surrender when Wilson shot Brown are inconsistent with the physical evidence, are otherwise not credible because of internal inconsistencies, or are not credible because of inconsistencies with other credible evidence.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/08/harris-warren-wrong-about-brown-shooting/ published on 2019-08-12 22:33:58

- “Information is moving so quickly that the void will be filled in with rumor if you are not willing or able to put out as much fact as you know about the incident,” said Dallas Police Chief David Brown." Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-police-transparency/police-chiefs-pledge-more-transparency-after-ferguson-idUSKBN0HC2IC20140917 published on 2014-09-17 22:40:48
correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misleading. While it's true that Michael Brown was shot by a police officer, the Department of Justice determined that the officer acted in self-defense. The claim that Brown was "murdered" is not supported by the findings of the investigation. However, the incident did indeed spark important conversations about race relations and police transparency. 
https://www.factcheck.org/2019/08/harris-warren-wrong-about-brown-shooting/
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-police-transparency/police-chiefs-pledge-more-transparency-after-ferguson-idUSKBN0HC2IC20140917
note_1_text: The claim that Brown was murdered has been fact-checked and determined false: "the [Obama] Justice Department found no credible evidence to support that claim." https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2019/08/13/harris-warren-ignore-doj-report-claim-that-michael-brown-was-murdered/
note_2_text: "And so now at this point, we're looking at the - we looked at the evidence with a fresh set of eyes. And, you know, unfortunately, we just - we don't have the evidence to ethically bring a charge against Darren Wilson."  - St. Louis County Prosecuting Attorney Wesley Bell    https://text.npr.org/897836660

refute_evidences: - "The shots Wilson fired “were in self-defense and thus were not objectively unreasonable under the Fourth Amendment,” which prohibits unreasonable seizures and use of force, the report said. It concluded that Wilson’s “actions do not constitute prosecutable violations under the applicable federal criminal civil rights statute, 18 U.S.C. § 242, which prohibits uses of deadly force that are ‘objectively unreasonable,’ as defined by the United States Supreme Court.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/08/harris-warren-wrong-about-brown-shooting/ published on 2019-08-12 22:33:58

- The chiefs said that even though a police shooting might be ruled justifiable under law, they had to hold officers to higher moral and ethical standards to satisfy the community. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-police-transparency/police-chiefs-pledge-more-transparency-after-ferguson-idUSKBN0HC2IC20140917 published on 2014-09-17 22:40:48

- On Aug. 9, white Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson shot and killed 18-year-old Michael Brown, an unarmed African American. The shooting led to a federal civil rights probe and shone an international spotlight on race relations in America. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-police-transparency/police-chiefs-pledge-more-transparency-after-ferguson-idUSKBN0HC2IC20140917 published on 2014-09-17 22:40:48

- Wilson has been placed on paid administrative leave and has gone into hiding, as the county prosecutor presents evidence to a grand jury to determine if any charges are filed. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-missouri-shooting/ferguson-council-to-meet-for-first-time-since-michael-brown-shooting-idUKKBN0H411320140909 published on 2014-09-09 11:08:15

- Witnesses have reported that Brown had his hands in the air when Wilson shot him shortly after noon as he and a friend walked down a residential street. An autopsy showed Brown was shot at least six times, including twice in the head. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-missouri-shooting/ferguson-council-to-meet-for-first-time-since-michael-brown-shooting-idUKKBN0H411320140909 published on 2014-09-09 11:08:15

- On Aug. 9, 2014, Michael Brown, an unarmed 18-year-old black man, was shot and killed by a white police officer in Ferguson, Missouri, in what the Obama administration’s Department of Justice determined was an act of “self-defense.” Reference: https://www.factcheck.org/2019/08/harris-warren-wrong-about-brown-shooting/ published on 2019-08-12 22:33:58
tweet_category: Human Rights, Social Issues, and Activism
tweet_text: Today marks eight years since Michael Brown was murdered by police in Ferguson, MO. We need to honor Michael’s life with action. Let’s keep fighting to dismantle white supremacy, so we can ensure racial justice for all.
user_description: Congressmember for WA-07 and lifelong organizer for immigrant, civil, and human rights. Progressive Caucus Chair. Bold, unafraid, and a proud mom. She/her.
